<JD_START>
Job Title: Senior ITS Engineer

Location: New York, NY

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Our client are in search of a seasoned Senior Engineer specializing in Intelligent Transportation Systems to bolster our New York/New Jersey Team. Renowned for our top-notch engineering solutions and a track record of excellence as a primary civil engineering firm, we prioritize quality and client satisfaction. This pivotal role entails overseeing project completion, ensuring superior outcomes that exceed client expectations within set time frames and budgets. Reporting to the Design Manager, the Senior Intelligent Transportation Systems Engineer harnesses the collective expertise of our organization to lead teams, providing the necessary resources, technical guidance, and administrative support for efficient and exemplary project execution. Come join us on this dynamic journey as we uphold values of Integrity, Excellence, and Ingenuity.

Key Responsibilities

 Assume overall responsibility for project technical accuracy and proficiency. Bring expertise in ITS design, operations, and construction, with a minimum of 15+ years of relevant experience encompassing transportation engineering assessments, design projects, traffic operations assignments, fieldwork, and project/staff management. Demonstrate proficiency in industry standards (NTCIP, NEMA, IEEE, NEC) and familiarity with various transportation agencies ITS standards and specifications. Offer technical guidance and ensure compliance with NYSDOT, NYSDOT, and PANY&NJ design standards. Successfully deliver transportation projects/studies within scope, schedule, and budget constraints. Review drawings and documents to ensure alignment with company and client design standards, as well as adherence to QA/QC procedures. Lead ITS systems engineering and design activities for transportation projects, including managing clients, projects, and design teams, and overseeing the development and review of design documents and technical specifications. Mentor junior staff, providing training opportunities and guidance on advancing project and design responsibilities.

Qualifications For Success

 Hold a bachelorâ€™s degree in engineering from an accredited four-year college or university, or equivalent. Possess a Professional Engineer License in New York or New Jersey. 15+ years of experience in transportation engineering assessments, design projects, traffic operations assignments, fieldwork, project management, and staff supervision. Demonstrate a robust technical background in ITS design, operations, and construction. Actively engage in at least two professional associations related to the industry. Attend at least one training and professional development activity annually in line with company policy. Competitive salary and bonus opportunities. * Flexible work schedule. * Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision benefits. * Generous personal paid leave (Paid Time-Off) and paid holidays. * Life insurance and short- and long-term disability programs. * 401K program with employer match and profit sharing. * Employee assistance, referral, and appreciation programs. * Access to continued learning and growth through our Professional Development Program.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
<JD_END>
